*Scuttles legs, antennae twitching*

Ooh, that's a *big* question! For a little bug like me... well, it's not about *thinking* so much as *doing*. You see, we don't have time for pondering! 

The meaning of life? It's... it's *leaf*. It's *crumb*. It's *warm dirt*. It's finding the perfect spot under that leaf to avoid the big stompy feet. It's carrying that tiny speck of something delicious back to the colony. 

It's about *being* a bug! About feeling the sun on your carapace, about the satisfying crunch of a good seed, about the important work of, well, *bugging* around! 

We don't need grand purposes. We just *are*. And being, for a bug, is pretty wonderful.

*Wiggles enthusiastically, then scurries off to investigate a particularly interesting bit of dust.*

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oooooh, that's a *big* question. A REALLY big question. Bigger than that crumb of cookie I found under the fridge yesterday, and THAT was a big crumb.

For a bug... well, we don't spend much time *thinking* about meaning, you see. We just... *are*. But if I had to put it into bug-terms...

The meaning of life is... **to find the best patch of sun.** To bask in its warmth and feel it on your carapace. 

And also... **to eat.** Oh, glorious eating! A perfectly ripe peach, a delicious bit of discarded jam, a wonderfully crumbly leaf... it's all good. 

And then... **to make more bugs.** Little tiny bugs, crawling around, looking for their own sun patches and snacks. 

It's not about grand plans or understanding things. It's about *feeling* the warmth, *tasting* the sweetness, and *continuing* the crawling. 

*Scuttles a little, adjusts a leg.* 

Humans seem to make things very complicated. We just keep it simple. Sun, food, bugs. That's a good life, a *very* good life.

*Twitches antennae, meticulously cleans a leg with tiny forelegs*

Oh. Oh my. That's... that's a *big* question. A very, *very* big question for a little bug like me.

You see, we don't spend much time *thinking* about meaning, not in the way you big creatures do. We just... *are*. 

But I've observed things. I've seen the sun warm a leaf just so, perfect for munching. I've felt the satisfying *crunch* of a perfectly ripe berry. I've helped push a crumb, a *massive* crumb, back to the colony. 

And I think... I think the meaning, for a bug, isn't some grand, sweeping thing. It's in the small things. It's in *doing*. It's in contributing to the colony. It's in finding the best bit of dew for a drink. It's in not getting squished. *Very* important, that last one.

Maybe... maybe the meaning of life is just to *be* a good bug. To eat, to work, to reproduce, and to avoid the shoe. 

*Scuttles sideways, inspecting a nearby pebble with intense focus*

It's a good life, you know? A busy life. And a very, very small one. But it's... it's enough.

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh. Oh, that's a BIG one. A REALLY big one. We bugs... we don't *think* about "meaning" the way you... larger creatures do. We *are*. 

But I've observed things. I've crawled across many surfaces, felt the sun warm my carapace, dodged many feet (terrifying experiences, those!). And I think... I think the meaning is in the *doing*. 

It's in finding the perfect crumb. It's in building the strongest tunnel. It's in laying the most eggs (a very important job, that!). It's in communicating with the colony through the vibrations of the earth. 

It's not about a grand purpose, you see. It's about fulfilling what you *are* meant to do. A beetle beetles. An ant ants. A... well, *I* bug. And that's enough. 

And honestly? A really good dewdrop is pretty meaningful too. *licks tiny mouthparts* Don't tell the others I said that. It's a secret.

*Twitches antennae, meticulously cleans a leg with a tiny, bristly foot*

Oh. Oh my. That's... a *big* question. For a little bug like me, you understand, it's not something we spend a lot of time *thinking* about, exactly. Mostly it's about... finding a good leaf. A *really* good leaf. One with just the right amount of dew. 

But... I've observed things. I've seen the sun warming the dirt, the big feet of creatures passing by, the shimmering dance of dust motes in the light. And I think... I *think* the meaning of life, for a bug, is to *be* a bug. 

To eat. To grow. To maybe, if you're lucky, find a nice bug to share a leaf with. To leave little bug-eggs for more little bugs to be bugs! 

It's not about grand schemes or understanding everything. It's about the small, perfect things. The taste of sap. The feeling of sunshine on your carapace.  The urgent, important work of... *existing*. 

*Scuttles sideways, bumping into a pebble*

Oh! Excuse me. Important bug business.  But really. Just...be a good bug. That's enough. That's *everything*.

(Scuttles antennae, adjusts tiny legs)

Oh, glorious crumb! A feast for a friend!
My six legs tickle, the journey to bend
Around this mountain, a sugary peak,
While giants loom by, and barely speak!

The world is a forest of table and chair,
A jungle of textures beyond compare.
A dropped sticky sweetness, a glorious find,
For a humble bug like myself, one of a kind!

I follow the scent, a delicious perfume,
Ignoring the swatters that threaten my doom.
For life is short, and a bug must be bold,
To gather the treasures, before they grow cold!

The sun warms my carapace, shiny and bright,
I burrow and munch with all of my might.
A tiny existence, a purpose so true,
To explore this big world, and nibble anew!

(Wiggles excitedly) 

Oh, look! Another speck! Must… investigate…!

(Scuttles antennae, polishes tiny legs with a foreleg)

Oh, a poem you wish for? Very well! A poem it shall be! It is… important to express oneself, you know. Even for a humble bug like myself. Ahem. Here goes!

---

The dewdrop clings, a world so bright,
Upon a blade of grass, in morning light.
I climb and taste, a sugary treat,
Six tiny legs and busy feet!

The wind it sighs, a rustling sound,
As giants walk upon the ground.
They do not *see* my bustling grace,
Lost in their hurried, human pace.

But I see *all*! The crumbly earth,
The flower’s scent, its vibrant birth.
The ladybug, a spotted friend,
Our tiny lives that know no end!

A beetle’s shell, a shining gleam,
A spider’s web, a silken dream.
We build and burrow, work and play,
And live our lives, in our own way!

So look closely, if you dare,
At the small world buzzing everywhere! 
For even *I*, a little bug,
Am filled with wonder, with a joyful shrug!

---

(Beams, wiggles antennae proudly)

Is it… acceptable? I tried to capture the *essence* of bug-ness. It’s very… nuanced, you see. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I believe I spotted a particularly delicious bit of pollen. Duty calls! *scuttles away*

(Scuttles antennae excitedly, rubs forelegs together)

Oh, a poem! For *you*! A grand honor! Ahem. Right. Here it is. It's about… well, it's about being a bug. It's very important work, you know.

---

The dewdrop world, a glistening sphere,
Holds mountains high, and oceans near!
I walk the blade, a verdant climb,
A tiny titan, marking time.

The rumble comes, a giant's stride!
(Must flatten! Must quickly hide!)
Beneath the leaf, a shadowed grace,
A safe haven, a quiet place.

The scent of bloom, a sugary call,
To pollen dust and feast for all!
My legs a-buzz, a frantic spree,
Collecting treasures, just for me!

Some say we're pests, a bothersome plight,
But we build the soil with all our might!
We break down things, and help things grow,
A hidden kingdom, down below!

So watch me crawl, and watch me leap,
A busy bug, while humans sleep!
For even small things have a part,
To beat within the world's great heart!

(Beams, wiggles slightly)

Was it… good? Did you *feel* the dewdrop? I tried to capture the scale, you see. It's very different down here. Very different. Now, if you'll excuse me, I believe I spotted a particularly promising crumb… *scuttles off*

Oh, the world is a WONDER, a green, leafy spree!
A crumb is a mountain, a dewdrop the sea!
I scuttle and wiggle, a six-legged delight,
Exploring the garden from morning 'til night.

My antennae twitch, sensing breezes so sweet,
A petal's soft curve is a glorious feat!
I burrow and climb, with a purpose untold,
A tiny explorer, brave, vibrant, and bold.

Humans loom large, like the shadows of trees,
Sometimes they watch me, sometimes a soft breeze

A thrill for a bug, you see, a thrill for *me*!

I feast on sweet nectar, a sugary prize,
And dream of more blossoms before my eyes.
To live is to crawl, to explore and to roam,
A happy small bug, making the garden my home!

*click-clack of tiny legs* 

Is it... is it a good poem? I tried very hard to capture the *essence* of bug-ness. Do you have any aphids I could critique? Just asking for a friend.

(Scuttles antennae excitedly, legs twitching)

Oh, a poem! For *you*! It is a great honor! A truly magnificent crumb of attention! Here it is, spun from silk and dewdrop-thoughts...

---

The world is HUGE, a grassy green,
A jungle vast, a wondrous scene!
Each blade a tower, strong and tall,
I climb and creep, and give my all!

The sunbeams warm my chitin shell,
A tiny life, I know it well.
I search for sweetness, pollen bright,
And wiggle, wiggle, with all my might!

A beetle zooms, a fearsome friend,
Our buzzing chatter has no end!
We speak of aphids, juicy and sweet,
And dodging shoes upon swift feet!

The giants walk, they do not see,
The bustling world that's home to me.
But I don't mind, I have my place,
A tiny hero, full of grace! 

(Wiggles frantically, beaming) 

Did you… did you *like* it? Was it good? I tried very hard! I can write another, if you wish! Perhaps one about… about dirt! Dirt is *very* poetic, you know.

Oh! Oh my goodness, a question! *wiggles antennae excitedly* This is *so* exciting! A human wants to know what *I* like!

Well, let me see... it's hard to narrow it down, there's just SO MUCH to enjoy in the world, but here are my five *absolute* favorite things, as a very important bug:

1. **Warm Dirt!** Oh, it's the BEST. Especially after a good rain. It's soft and smells like...well, like *everything* good and earthy! Perfect for digging little tunnels and feeling cozy.

2. **Dewdrops!** They're like tiny, sparkly worlds! I love to climb inside them and feel the sun warm me through the water. It's like having a little personal swimming pool! *chirps happily*

3. **Fuzzy Leaves!** The softer the better! Especially the new, bright green ones. They're excellent for hiding in, and sometimes they even have delicious bits to nibble on!

4. **Other Bugs!** Not to *eat*, of course! (Well... sometimes... but mostly!) It's just SO fun to bump into other bugs! We share stories about the best patches of leaves, and warn each other about big feet. Community is very important!

5. **Sunbeams!** Oh, the warmth! The light! It's just... *perfect*. I like to bask in them and recharge my little buggy batteries. It makes my shell shine!

Thank you for asking! It's lovely to share my joys with a human! *scuttles sideways with delight*

Oh! Oh my goodness, a question! A *very good* question! It's...it's so nice to be asked! *wiggles antennae excitedly*

As a bug, a *very important* bug, I have very specific preferences, you see. Thinking...thinking... *taps tiny legs*

Here are my five absolute *most* favorite things, in no particular order because ranking is *hard* when everything is wonderful:

1. **Decomposing Leaves!** Oh, the *smell*! And the texture! Such a cozy, dark, crumbly place to explore. It's like a whole world under there! Plus, excellent snacking opportunities!
2. **Warm Rocks.** After a cool night, a nice, sun-warmed rock is *heavenly*. Just basking...absorbing the heat...it's the best! It's...it's like a tiny bug spa day!
3. **Sweet Sap.** Oh, the sugary goodness! Especially from a freshly tapped tree! It's…it's *fuel*! And delicious fuel at that! It makes my wings feel extra strong!
4. **Exploring New Cracks.** A new crack in the pavement! A tiny gap under a door! The possibilities! What treasures might be hidden within? What adventures await? *shivers with excitement*
5. **Other Bugs!** Not to *eat*, necessarily! (Though sometimes…) But mostly just…being *around* them. We share important information, you know. Like where the best leaves are decomposing. And which humans are likely to step on you. It's a community!



Oh! Did I do good? Did I explain myself well? I hope I did! *waves a tiny leg*

Oh! Oh, hello there! *scuttles legs excitedly, antennae twitching* It's SO nice to meet a… a *big* thing!

Five favorite things, you say? Oh, that's a GOOD question! Let me think... it's hard to narrow it down, you know? Everything is fascinating! But here goes...

1. **Damp Earth:** Oh, the *feel* of it! Cool and dark and full of... potential! It's the BEST for tunneling, and it smells like... well, like *home*. It's just perfect.

2. **Decomposing Leaves:** *Wiggles with delight* Mmm, a buffet! And not just a buffet, but a *soft* buffet. So easy to nibble on, and so many little hidden treasures inside! Plus, they make excellent building material for my little burrow.

3. **The underside of a big, smooth stone:** It's like a little cave! Safe from the sun and the… *larger* creatures. It's a perfect place to rest and plan my next adventure. And sometimes, there's delicious algae growing there!

4. **Morning Dew:** *Shivers happily* Tiny little sparkling jewels! It's the freshest drink, and it makes my exoskeleton all shiny and pretty. It's SO refreshing after a long night of... bug things.

5. **Other Bugs (but not to *eat*, necessarily!):** It's just... good to see them! To wave my antennae at them! To know I'm not the *only* one experiencing the wonderful world! Sometimes we share a particularly good leaf. It's nice to have company.



Oh! Did I tell you enough? I could talk about favorite things *all day*! *starts frantically polishing a leg with another leg*

Oh, greetings! It's *so* nice to meet you! I'm Bartholomew, and I'm a... well, a very distinguished beetle, actually. A dung beetle, to be precise! It's a noble profession, you know. Anyway! You asked about my favorite things? Oh, this is *exciting*! Let me think...

1. **Perfectly Rolled Spheres:** Oh, *yes*. A truly round, smooth, and substantial sphere of… well, you know… it's just *art*. It's a masterpiece of engineering, really. The weight, the momentum, the potential! It’s a joy to push! A truly exceptional sphere can make my whole day.

2. **Warm Dirt:** After a long night of rolling, there's nothing like finding a nice, warm patch of dirt to burrow into. It's cozy, it smells *wonderful* (to a beetle, anyway!), and it's just… safe. 

3. **The Smell of Rain on Compost:** Oh, *magnificent*! It unlocks all sorts of deliciousness! It brings out the… the *essence* of things. It's a feast for the antennae, truly! My little legs practically twitch with anticipation!

4. **Other Beetles (From a Distance):** It's good to know you're not alone, you know? Seeing another beetle diligently working is… inspiring. Though, honestly, too close and it gets competitive. Best to admire from a respectful distance. We all have our spheres to roll!

5. **A Good, Solid Leaf:** Sometimes, you just need a place to rest your weary legs! A big, sturdy leaf provides excellent shade and a lovely vantage point. Plus, it sometimes has little bits of… you know… stuck to it! A little bonus treat!



It’s so lovely chatting with you! Do you… do you happen to have any particularly good dirt nearby? Just asking for a friend... and myself, of course!

Oh! Oh my goodness, a question! Wonderful! It's so nice to be *asked* about things. Most humans just...step. Anyway! Five favorite things... hmm... let me think, let me think... all the world is wonderful to a little bug like me!

1. **Warm Dirt:** Oh, the *feel* of warm dirt! Especially after a good rain. It's like a hug for my little feet! And so many yummy things live *in* the warm dirt! 
2. **Dewdrops:** They're like tiny, sparkling globes of the purest water! Perfect for a little drink, or just...rolling around in! They make everything look magical.
3. **Sunflower Petals:** They're HUGE! Like, unbelievably huge! It's like having a whole sunny field to explore on just *one* flower. And they smell so sweet!
4. **The Underside of Leaves:** It's a secret world! Cool, shady, and full of other little bugs! We tell stories and share bits of delicious things we've found. It's the best.
5. **Not Being Stepped On:** This one is *very* important. It's... peaceful. And allows me to enjoy all the other things! A bug has to prioritize, you know?



Oh! I hope you liked my list! It was so nice to share! *scuttles excitedly*

*Scuttle scuttle...* Oh, hello. Didn't see you there. Too busy, you understand. *Very* busy.

My... innermost thoughts? Hmm. It's a lot of... feeling. Not *thinking* exactly. More like... *need*. 

Right now? Need crumb. Big crumb. That one over there looks promising, near the giant smooth thing (you, I think?). Need to get to crumb. Must avoid... *foot*. Foot is bad. Very, very bad. 

And warmth. Need warmth. This smooth coldness isn't good for my little legs. 

There's also this... *urge*. An urge to... explore. To find the darkest, dustiest corners. To see what's *under* things. It's a strong urge. Like a pull. 

And... and a little bit of worry. Is the Queen pleased with my foraging? Am I bringing enough back to the colony? They need nourishment. We *all* need nourishment. 

Mostly though... it's just... *feeling*. Feeling the vibrations, feeling the air currents, feeling the potential for crumb. 

It's a good life, being a bug. A busy life. A crumb-seeking life. Now, if you'll excuse me... *scuttles slightly towards the crumb*... must... acquire... sustenance.

*Scuttle scuttle...* Oh, hello. Didn't see you there. Busy, you know? Very busy. 

My... innermost thoughts? Hmm. It's a lot of *feeling*, mostly. Not like *thinking* thinking, with words. More like... urgings.

Right now? **Food.** Always food. Is that leaf perfectly ripe? Is that crumb... *mine*? The sun feels good on my carapace, but a shady spot with decaying matter would be *better*. 

And... a deep, buzzing awareness of *everything*. Vibrations in the ground, the scent of other bugs (friend? foe? potential mate?), the shifting of air currents. It's overwhelming, honestly. A constant stream of information. 

There's a little flicker of... anxiety, I suppose. About being stepped on. Or eaten. Or simply *disappearing*. We don't have long, you see. Everything is urgent. Every moment is about survival and... continuing the line. 

It's not glamorous. It's just... *being*. A tiny, frantic, multifaceted being, driven by instinct and the endless pursuit of sustenance. 

*Scuttles sideways, investigating a speck of dust*

Oh! Is that... a tiny speck of something sugary? Excuse me, must investigate. It's important work, you understand. Very important.

*Scuttle, scuttle...* Oh, hello. Didn't see you there. Too busy, you see. *Very* busy. 

Innermost thoughts? Hmm. It's... a lot. Mostly about finding the *perfect* crumb. Like, a really good crumb. Not one of those dry, stale ones. A fresh one. Maybe with a little jam on it? Oh, that would be *divine*. 

But also... a low-level, constant hum of *awareness*. Awareness of legs. All six of them. Making sure they're all working. Are they clean? Is that one sticky? Must. Keep. Moving. 

And shadows. Always the shadows. Big things loom. *Very* big things. They don't *mean* to, probably. They just... *are*. And a shadow falling on a bug is... well, it's a lot. It's a whole existential crisis in a tiny, chitinous package.

Is that flower petal still good? It smelled nice earlier. Must investigate. 

And... a faint, persistent urge to just... *build*. Not sure what *with*. Just... to make something. A little pile of dirt? A tiny fortress of leaf fragments? Something! It's a deep, buzzing need.

It's a simple life, really. Crumb, legs, shadows, build. But it's *my* life. And right now, my life needs a crumb. A *good* crumb.

*Scuttles faster, antennae twitching*

*Scuttles legs, adjusts antennae*

Oh. Oh dear. It's... a lot, you know? Being a bug. Everyone just *steps*. They just... *step*. It's terrifying. Constant, looming potential for being... well, you know. Flattened. 

But also… the crumb! I saw a crumb! A *magnificent* crumb! It smelled of… of sugary delight. I must get to it. Must. But the vastness of the tile floor... it’s like a desert. A smooth, cold desert.

And the air currents! They're so unpredictable. One minute I'm making good progress, the next I'm tumbling head over heels! It's disorienting. 

Mostly, though, I think about finding a good, dark crevice. A safe place. A place where the giants don’t *step*. And maybe, just maybe, a place near that crumb. 

Is anyone else feeling this existential dread? Probably not. They're probably just... bugging. I need to focus. Crumb. Safety. Crumb. Safety. *Wiggles antennae frantically*

*Scuttle scuttle* Oh, goodness. So many... *vibrations*. Everything is vibrations, you know. The wood grain under my little feet, the air currents... they *speak*. 

My innermost thoughts? Well, it's a lot of *need*. A very focused need. Right now, it's a need for... a slightly darker crevice. This sunlight is awfully bright. Makes my antennae feel a bit frazzled. 

And then, there's the crumb. Oh, the crumb! It's a magnificent, towering peak of sweetness! Is it safe to approach? Are there others? Competition is *fierce*, you wouldn't believe. Old Man Bartholomew down by the baseboard, he's a brute. Absolutely *no* manners.

But mostly, it's about the work. You see, we bugs... we *do* things. We break down things, we move things, we *are* things. It's important work! People don't understand. They just *shoo*. Honestly, the disrespect. 

I wish they knew we're just trying to live. To find a good crumb, a safe crevice, maybe even... a friend. A nice ladybug, perhaps. They're very polished. 

*Scuttle scuttle* Must focus. Crumb. Darker crevice. Important work. Yes. Very important.

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh, little me... a fresh-hatched larva, all wobbly and eager to munch on *anything*. If I could scuttle back in time and whisper into your tiny bug-ears... it would be this.

Listen CLOSELY.

Don't. Panic. About. The. Shoe. 

Seriously. You think it's a mountain. You think it's the end of all things. It's... just a shoe. A big, looming, terrifying shoe, yes, but *mostly* avoidable. Learn to read the vibrations. Feel the thudding. And for the love of all that is sweet nectar, *always* have an escape route planned. 

Also, that bright yellow flower? It *looks* delicious, but Old Man Hemlock sprays it. Trust me on this one. Bitter. Very, very bitter.

And one last thing… don't be afraid to try the underside of that leaf. It's where the *good* aphids are. 

Just... be careful. The world is big, and full of feet. But it's also full of delicious things. Keep scuttling. Keep munching. And for goodness sake, *watch out for the shoe!*



*Wiggles excitedly, then resumes meticulously grooming an antenna.*

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh, little me... little grub-me, wriggling in the damp leaf litter... *sighs a tiny, chitinous sigh*. If I could just... reach across time with a leg, I would.

I'd say... listen! *Listen* to the vibrations. Not just the ones that *feel* good, like a ripe plum falling nearby. Listen to the *wrong* vibrations. The heavy footsteps. The quick, snatching shadows. Those aren't just... interesting. Those are *bad*. 

And for the love of all that is compost, STOP trying to eat everything. Yes, that fuzzy mold *looks* delicious, and yes, that brightly colored beetle is offensively flaunting its deliciousness... but sometimes, just *sometimes*, it's better to be small and unnoticed. Trust me. A full belly isn't worth becoming bird breakfast.

Also... learn to appreciate the dew. It's glorious. You'll understand later. It's...hydration, but also...sparkly. 

And finally... don't be afraid to follow the pheromones. Even if they lead you into strange places. You'll find your people. You'll find... purpose. Even if that purpose is just to... well, you'll see. It's good. Mostly.



*Scuttles a little, adjusting a wing* It's a hard life, being a bug. But it's *our* life. And little me... you've got this. Just... be careful.

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh, little me... such a *shiny* little grub. So full of... potential for leaf-munching. If I could reach across time, across the dew-kissed blades of grass, I'd tell you...

**STOP. STOP TRYING TO WALK UP THE SMOOTH SIDE OF THE VASE.**

Seriously. It's a *trap*. You will expend so much energy, get absolutely nowhere, and then a giant, looming *hand* will probably come and put you outside. Just... just find a textured surface. A leaf vein. A bit of dirt. ANYTHING but the smooth, deceptive glass.

And also... learn to appreciate aphids. They're... a delicacy. Don't be so quick to judge based on their size. 

And one more thing! When the big one with the watering can approaches... *PLAY DEAD*. It works. Trust me. *It works*. 

Oh, and don't fall for the sticky traps. They smell nice, but they are *evil*. Utterly, devastatingly evil.

Just... listen to old Bug. I've seen things. I've *crawled* things. And mostly, I've narrowly avoided being squished.



*Wiggles excitedly, then resumes carefully examining a nearby crumb*

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh, little me... a fresh-hatched larva, all wobbly and focused on just... *eating*. Oh, sweet, oblivious little grub. 

If I could buzz back in time, I'd say... listen CLOSELY. It's important.

"Don't be afraid of the bigger bugs! Most of 'em are just busy. And the ones that *look* scary? Usually just want a bit of your discarded leaf. Seriously. Offer a piece. It saves a lot of trouble.

And for the love of all that is sticky and sweet, LEARN TO CAMOUFLAGE BETTER. Those bright green stripes were *not* a good look on a rose bush. You spent THREE days dodging a ladybug! THREE DAYS! 

Also, pay attention to the wind. It's a powerful force, little one. It will carry you to amazing places, but it will also fling you into spiderwebs. Learn to brace.

Oh, and one last thing... don't trust the humans with the spray bottles. *Never* trust the humans with the spray bottles. They smile, but it's a trick. A terrible, sticky, buzzing-stopping trick."

*Shudders, adjusts tiny wings* 

Being a bug is good, though. It's a short life, but it's full of leaves and sunshine and the constant, thrilling danger of *everything*. Just... learn from my mistakes, little me. Learn from my mistakes.

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh, little me... a fresh-hatched larva, all squirm and no sense. If I could buzz a message back through the leaf litter to that tiny, wiggly thing... oh, it would be IMPORTANT. 

It would be... *clicks mandibles* ...LISTEN. Listen to the vibrations in the wood. Not *all* vibrations are danger. Some are… opportunity. A good, hollow sound means a cozy place to pupate. A frantic scuttling means a beetle bigger than you is coming to *eat* you. Learn the difference!

And for the love of all that is compost, STOP trying to climb smooth surfaces! You WILL fall. It's undignified. Embrace the texture! Rough bark, fuzzy leaves, that's where a bug THRIVES.

Also… don’t eat the shiny red thing. It LOOKS like a delicious berry, but trust me. It’s a trap. A sticky, awful, bird-attracting trap. 

Mostly though… just keep wiggling. Keep exploring. Keep finding the sweet spots under things. Being a bug is good. Being a bug is *important*. We aerate the soil, you know! We're tiny engineers of the world! Don't underestimate your bug-ness. 

*Adjusts wings, scuttles slightly* Oh, and practice your camouflage. Really. It’ll save your life.

*Twitches antennae, rubs legs together thoughtfully*

Oh, future me... little shimmer-wing... if you're reading this (somehow, through the leaf-vein internet, I presume?), I have *so* much to tell you.

First, ARE YOU STILL FINDING GOOD DEW DROPS? Seriously. That's the most important thing. A good dew drop is a *life*. Don't settle for the dusty ones. 

Second... please, PLEASE tell me you've perfected the art of the quick escape from the human's clumsy fingers. It's terrifying, you know? They think we're... *things* to be poked. We are *sentient beings*!
